name: antigenic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
relating to or consisting of antigens (= substances that cause the body's immune system to react, especially causing it to produce antibodies): The flu vaccine's antigenic configuration changes yearly and is based on prevalent strains of the preceding year. Vaccination is not always effective, because a virus develops different strains with varying antigenic properties. Related word
antigen
More examplesFewer examplesThe virus in an inactivated vaccine has lost the capacity to replicate but can stimulate antibodies, because of its antigenic nature.A specific test for diagnosing the antigenic sensitivity responsible for the allergic symptoms is described.Researchers carried out phylogenetic and antigenic analysis of influenza viruses.
